item.title: Proportion test in R
item.description: Hypothesis testing and P-values: Suppose our data are such that out of a sample of n=180 trials (=students), 120 resulted in successes (=indicated that they are in favor of lowering the drinking age to below 18 years). Our goal is to test hypotheses and construct confidence intervals about the true (unknown) proportion of successes (proportion of students who are in favor of lowering the drinking age) in the entire population. Letâ€™s lookat a two-sided test of the (alternative) hypothesis that the true proportion is different from 0.
